atom.name: Atom
atom.description: Help improve Atom by sending usage statistics, exceptions and deprecations to the team.

telemetry.name: Usage data
telemetry.description: The user's decision is stored at core.telemetryConsent. The three possible values are undecided, no and limited. The intent is that consent is given if and only if limited is chosen.

automated-lab.name: AutomatedLab
automated-lab.description: AutomatedLab will start to collect telemetry starting with version 5.0. This is an opt-out collection and you will be asked once to specify whether or not you want to send us telemetry data.

aws-sam-cli.name: AWS SAM CLI
aws-sam-cli.description: At AWS, we develop and launch services based on what we learn from interactions with customers. We use customer feedback to iterate on our product. Telemetry is additional information that helps us to better understand our customers’ needs, diagnose issues, and deliver features that improve the customer experience. The AWS SAM CLI collects telemetry, such as generic usage metrics, system and environment information, and errors.

azure-cli.name: Azure CLI
azure-cli.description: Allow Microsoft to collect anonymous data on the usage of the CLI.

consul.name: Consul
consul.description: Consul makes use of a HashiCorp service called Checkpoint which is used to check for updates and critical security bulletins.

telemetry.name: Update check
telemetry.description: Disables automatic checking for security bulletins and new version releases. This is disabled in Consul Enterprise.

telemetry.name: Update check signature
telemetry.description: Disables providing an anonymous signature for de-duplication with the update check

cordova-cli.name: Apache Cordova CLI
cordova-cli.description: We use the gathered information to help us make our tool more useful and to better understand how it is used. We do not track or collect personally identifiable information or associate gathered data with any personally identifying information from other sources.

firefox.name: Firefox
firefox.description: Telemetry collects information about your Firefox browsing experience to improve Firefox features, browser performance and stability.

telemetry.name: Enable policies (macOS)
telemetry.description: Enable Firefox policies so the telemetry can be configured.

telemetry.name: Usage data
telemetry.description:
Examples of the kind of data Telemetry sends to Mozilla includes start-up time, time between cycle collector runs, memory heap used, whether hardware graphics acceleration or Java is enabled, and more.
Telemetry does not collect any bookmarks or passwords. It may collect anonymized site visit information in some circumstances, such as when a secure browsing connection fails to connect, or for some experiments.

gatsby-js.name: Gatsby
gatsby-js.description: Gatsby contains a telemetry feature that collects anonymous usage information that is used to help improve Gatsby for all users. The Gatsby user base is growing very rapidly. It’s important that our small team and the greater community will better understand the usage patterns, so we can best decide how to design future features and prioritize current work.

google-cloud-sdk.name: Google Cloud SDK
google-cloud-sdk.description: Unless you opt-in during Google Cloud SDK installation, Cloud SDK software does not collect usage statistics. You can help Google to prioritize Google Cloud SDK features and improvements by permitting Cloud SDK to send command-line command usage statistics to Google.

hasura.name: Hasura GraphQL engine
hasura.description: The Hasura GraphQL engine collects anonymous telemetry data that helps the Hasura team in understanding how the product is being used and in deciding what to focus on next.

telemetry.name: Usage data (CLI and Console)
telemetry.description: The CLI collects each execution event, along with a randomly generated UUID. The execution event contains the command name, timestamp and whether the execution resulted in an error or not. Error messages, arguments and flags are not recorded. The CLI also collects the server version and UUID that it is talking to. The operating system platform and architecture is also noted along with the CLI version.

homebrew.name: Homebrew
homebrew.description: Homebrew has begun gathering anonymous aggregate user behaviour analytics and reporting these to Google Analytics.

k0s.name: k0s
k0s.description: To build better end user experience we collect and send telemetry data from clusters.

noop.name: Disable usage data reporting
noop.description: It is enabled by default and can be disabled by settings corresponding option as 'false'.

k8slens.name: Lens
k8slens.description: Lens collects telemetry data, which is used to help us understand how to improve the product. For example, this usage data helps us to debug issues and to prioritize new features.

noop.name: Disable usage data reporting
noop.description: If you don't wish to send usage data to Mirantis, you can disable the "Telemetry & Usage Tracking" in the Lens preferences.

microsoft-365-enterprise.name: Microsoft 365 | Enterprise
microsoft-365-enterprise.description: Microsoft is committed to providing you with the information and controls you need to make choices about how your data is collected and used when you’re using Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise (previously named Office 365 ProPlus).

telemetry.name: Diagnostic data
telemetry.description: Configure the level of client software diagnostic data sent by Office to Microsoft.

microsoft-calculator.name: Microsoft calculator
microsoft-calculator.description: This project collects usage data and sends it to Microsoft to help improve our products and services.

telemetry.name: Diagnostic data
telemetry.description: Diagnostic data is disabled in development builds by default, and can be enabled with the SEND_DIAGNOSTICS build flag.

net-core-sdk.name: .NET Core SDK
net-core-sdk.description: The NET Core SDK includes a telemetry feature that collects usage data and exception information when the .NET Core CLI crashes. The .NET Core CLI comes with the .NET Core SDK and is the set of verbs that enable you to build, test, and publish your .NET Core apps. It's important that the .NET team understands how the tools are used so they can be improved. Information on failures helps the team resolve problems and fix bugs.

netdata.name: Netdata
netdata.description: Starting with v1.12, Netdata collects anonymous usage information by default and sends it to Google Analytics.

netlify-cli.name: Netlify CLI
netlify-cli.description: By default, Netlify collects data on usage of Netlify CLI commands. We do this to improve the reliability and performance of Netlify CLI, and to help drive new features and improvements.

nextjs.name: Next.js
nextjs.description: Next.js collects completely anonymous telemetry data about general usage. Participation in this anonymous program is optional, and you may opt-out if you'd not like to share any information.

nvidia-drivers.name: Nvidia drivers
nvidia-drivers.description: Details on your device and network configurations, how you are using our products or services (including the software you are using), and details on how your system is performing, so we can optimize hardware and software configurations.

noop.name: NVCleanstall
noop.description: Our free software lets you customize the NVIDIA GeForce Driver package by removing components that you don't need (or want).

noop.name: Disable Nvidia Telemetry
noop.description: Disable Nvidia Telemetry is a utility that allows you to disable the telemetry services Nvidia bundles with their drivers.

packer.name: Packer
packer.description: When Packer is invoked it sometimes calls out to checkpoint.hashicorp.com to look for new versions of Packer.

powershell-core.name: PowerShell Core
powershell-core.description: PowerShell Core sends basic telemetry data to Microsoft when it is launched. The data includes the OS name, OS version, and PowerShell version. This data allows us to better understand the environments where PowerShell is used and enables us to prioritize new features and fixes.

prisma.name: Prisma
prisma.description: Telemetry helps us better understand how many users are using our products and how often they are using our products.

telemetry.name: Usage data
telemetry.description: Invocations of the prisma CLI and general usage of Studio results in data being sent to the telemetry server at https://checkpoint.prisma.io.

telemetry.name: Error reporting
telemetry.description: Before an error report is submitted, there will always be a prompt asking you to confirm or deny the submission of the error report!

noop.name: Disable error reporting
noop.description: You can opt-out of data collection by responding to the interactive prompt with no.

stripe-cli.name: Stripe CLI
stripe-cli.description: The Stripe CLI includes a telemetry feature that collects some usage data. This feature is enabled by default.

terraform.name: Terraform
terraform.description: The Terraform CLI commands interact with the HashiCorp service Checkpoint to check for the availability of new versions and for critical security bulletins about the current version.

telemetry.name: Update check
telemetry.description: Disable checkpoint calls entirely.

telemetry.name: Update check signature
telemetry.description: Disable the use of an anonymous signature in checkpoint requests. This allows Terraform to check for security bulletins but does not send the anonymous signature in these requests.

terraform-cdk.name: Cloud Development Kit for Terraform
terraform-cdk.description: CDK for Terraform CLI (cdktf-cli) interacts with a HashiCorp service called Checkpoint to report project metrics such as cdktf version, project language, provider name, platform name, and other details that help guide the project maintainers with feature and roadmap decisions.

tilt.name: Tilt
tilt.description: Tilt sends anonymized data about how you use it.

vagrant.name: Vagrant
vagrant.description: Vagrant interacts with HashiCorp services to provide update notifications.

telemetry.name: Vagrant update check
telemetry.description: Vagrant does occasional network calls to check whether the version of Vagrant that is running locally is up to date.

telemetry.name: Vagrant box update check
telemetry.description: By default, Vagrant will query the metadata API server to see if a newer box version is available for download.

vscode.name: VSCode
vscode.description: Visual Studio Code collects telemetry data, which is used to help understand how to improve the product.

telemetry.name: Usage data
telemetry.description: VS Code collects usage data that helps to debug issues, such as slow start-up times, and to prioritize new features.

telemetry.name: Crash data
telemetry.description: VS Code collects data about any crashes that occur and sends it to Microsoft to help improve our products and services.

weave-net.name: Weave Net
weave-net.description: Weave Net periodically contacts Weaveworks servers for available versions. New versions are announced in the log and in the status summary.

windows-10.name: Windows 10
windows-10.description: Microsoft collects Windows diagnostic data to solve problems and to keep Windows up to date, secure, and operating properly.

telemetry.name: Usage data | Enterpise
telemetry.description: Applies to: Windows 10 Enterprise/Education, Windows Server 2016 and newer

telemetry.name: Usage data
telemetry.description: There is no official way to disable telemetry in all other Windows editions (Home/Pro/etc...)

noop.name: ghacks.net | Comparison of Windows 10 Privacy tools
noop.description: We update the listing regularly. Please let us know about any updates that we may have missed, and about new programs that you found that are not on it already.

noop.name: github.com | crazy-max/WindowsSpyBlocker
noop.description: 🛡 Block spying and tracking on Windows

noop.name: github.com | Disassembler0/Win10-Initial-Setup-Script
noop.description: PowerShell script for automation of routine tasks done after fresh installations of Windows 10 / Server 2016 / Server 2019

noop.name: github.com | builtbybel/spydish
noop.description: 👀👮🐢🔥The Spydish app is the simplest way to perform a quick privacy and security check of your Windows 10 installation

noop.name: github.com | builtbybel/sharpapp
noop.description: 💩⭐️🚀A #app with cutting edge technology to #minimize windows-10 telemetry and #maximize privacy plus many more

windows-terminal.name: Windows Terminal
windows-terminal.description: The Windows Terminal client is instrumented to collect usage and diagnostic (error) data and sends it to Microsoft to help improve the product.

telemetry.name: Usage and Diagnostic data
telemetry.description: The Windows Terminal client respects machine wide privacy settings and users can opt-out on their device, as documented in the Microsoft Windows privacy statement.

noop.name: support.microsoft.com | Diagnostics, feedback, and privacy in Windows 10
noop.description: To opt-out, go to 'Start', then select 'Settings' > 'Privacy' > 'Diagnostics & feedback', and select 'Basic'.

winget-cli.name: winget
winget-cli.description: The winget.exe client is instrumented to collect usage and diagnostic (error) data and sends it to Microsoft to help improve the product.

telemetry.name: Usage and Diagnostic data
telemetry.description: The winget.exe client respects machine wide privacy settings and users can opt-out on their device, as documented in the Microsoft Windows privacy statement.

noop.name: support.microsoft.com | Diagnostics, feedback, and privacy in Windows 10
noop.description: To opt-out, go to 'Start', then select 'Settings' > 'Privacy' > 'Diagnostics & feedback', and select 'Basic'.

wksctl.name: WKSctl
wksctl.description: wksctl contacts Weaveworks servers for available versions. When a new version is available, wksctl will print out a message along with a URL to download it.
